framework.control

Class ModuleActionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • framework.control.ModuleActionHandler

  • public final class ModuleActionHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds all methods for modules and is mainly used by ProsumerConnector and ProviderConnector. It also excessively checks module rights with every call.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  ModuleActionHandler.PortProsumerTuple
      Internal helper class to store connections between ports and prosumers.
      private class  ModuleActionHandler.PortProviderTuple
      Internal helper class to store connections between ports and providers.

    • Method Detail

      • addStreamListener

        boolean addStreamListener(java.lang.String moduleId,
                          Port port,
                          StreamListener listener)
                   throws BrokerException,
                          AuthorizationException
        Adds a stream listener. Listener methods will get called whenever a stream at the given port is closed.

        Required rights: OBSERVE_STREAMS

        Parameters:
        moduleId - the module ID
        port - the port
        listener - the listener
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient

      • checkAndLock

        int checkAndLock(java.lang.String moduleId,
                 ProsumerPort sendingProsumerPort,
                 java.lang.String[] path)
          throws BrokerException,
                 ModuleException,
                 AuthorizationException
        Checks and locks an element at given path. See Provider.checkAndLock(ProviderPort, String[]) for more details.

        Required rights: READ_DATA, WRITE_DATA

        Parameters:
        moduleId - the module ID
        sendingProsumerPort - the sending prosumer port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the result code (see Provider interface)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient

                       throws BrokerException

        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • checkModuleState

        private void checkModuleState(java.lang.String moduleId)
                       throws BrokerException
        Checks module state. Only approved modules may call methods from this class. Modules become approved after returning from their constructor so most calls are forbidden from there.
        Parameters:
        moduleId - the module ID
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • createFolder

        int createFolder(java.lang.String moduleId,
                 ProsumerPort sendingProsumerPort,
                 java.lang.String[] path)
          throws BrokerException,
                 ModuleException,
                 AuthorizationException
        Creates a folder. If necessary parent folders are created automatically. See Provider.createFolder(ProviderPort, String[]) for more details.

        Required rights: READ_DATA, WRITE_DATA

        Parameters:
        moduleId - the module ID
        sendingProsumerPort - the sending prosumer port
        path - the path of the folder to create
        Returns:
        the result code (see Provider interface)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient

      • getChildElements

        java.util.Set<DataElement> getChildElements(java.lang.String moduleId,
                                            ProsumerPort sendingProsumerPort,
                                            java.lang.String[] path,
                                            boolean recursive)
                                     throws BrokerException,
                                            ModuleException,
                                            AuthorizationException
        Gets the child elements under a given parent path.

        Required rights: READ_DATA

        Parameters:
        moduleId - the module ID
        sendingProsumerPort - the sending prosumer port
        path - the path of the parent element
        recursive - set to true to get all children recursively (relative depth >= 1)
        Returns:
        the child elements (null if non existing/error or no children supported, for example within file elements)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient

                                                           Port sendingPort,
                                                           java.lang.String[] path)
                                                    throws BrokerException,
                                                           ModuleException,
                                                           AuthorizationException
        Gets the supported module commands (for a particular path).

        Required rights: SEND_COMMAND

        Parameters:
        moduleId - the module ID
        sendingPort - the sending port
        path - the path to get commands for (may be null)
        Returns:
        the supported module commands (may be null, for example if module does not answer before a timeout occurs)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient

      • move

        int move(java.lang.String moduleId,
         ProsumerPort sendingProsumerPort,
         java.lang.String[] srcPath,
         java.lang.String[] destPath)
  throws BrokerException,
         ModuleException,
         AuthorizationException
        Moves an element from one path to another within the same port. If necessary parent folders for destination are created automatically. Will NOT overwrite an existing destination element. See Provider.move(ProviderPort, String[], String[]) for more details.

        Required rights: READ_DATA, WRITE_DATA

        Parameters:
        moduleId - the module ID
        sendingProsumerPort - the sending prosumer port
        srcPath - the source path
        destPath - the destination path
        Returns:
        the result code (see Provider interface)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient

        provider - the provider
        portId - the port id
        maxConnections - the maximum number of concurrent active connections
        Returns:
        the provider port
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

                                 Port port)
                          throws BrokerException,
                                 AuthorizationException

      • sendModuleCommand

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sendModuleCommand(java.lang.String moduleId,
                                                                   java.lang.String command,
                                                                   Port sendingPort,
                                                                   java.lang.String[] path,
                                                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
                                                            throws BrokerException,
                                                                   ModuleException,
                                                                   AuthorizationException
        Sends a module command.

        Required rights: SEND_COMMAND

        Parameters:
        moduleId - the module ID
        command - the command
        sendingPort - the sending port
        path - the path (may be null)
        properties - the properties (may be null)
        Returns:
        the answer from module (may be null, for example if module does not answer before a timeout occurs)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient

           ModuleException,

      • writeData

        java.io.OutputStream writeData(java.lang.String moduleId,
                               ProsumerPort sendingProsumerPort,
                               java.lang.String[] path)
                        throws BrokerException,
                               ModuleException,
                               AuthorizationException
        Writes data to an element at given path, creates it if necessary (including parent folders).

        Required rights: WRITE_DATA

        Parameters:
        moduleId - the module ID
        sendingProsumerPort - the sending prosumer port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the output stream to write to (null if read only)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
